title: exFAT Driver for Windows XP/2003
description:
---------------------------------------------------
exFAT DRIVER for Windows XP and Windows Server 2003
---------------------------------------------------
a quick readme file by ACDC @ Taipei (2008/4/21)


--------------
What is exFAT?
--------------

Windows Vista Service Pack 1 (SP1) supports the new exFAT (extended FAT) feature.

The main advantages of exFAT are:

(a) access a file greater than 4GB (nice for storing HD-DVD or Blu-ray files.)
(b) store more than 1000 files in one directory.

But exFAT is NOT backward compatible with FAT32.
So if your removable storages are formatted as exFAT under Vista SP1, you need to 

For more information on exFAT, please refer to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exfat


-------------------------
What is this package for?
-------------------------

This file package contains exFAT driver files obtain from Vista SP1.
As exFAT driver also works on Windows XP/2003, this package will help you to install exFAT.

So, if you are using Windows XP or Windows Server 2003, this program can enable exFAT feature.
Then your removable storages which formatted in exFAT format under SP1 can be accessible in XP/2003.

But remember, you can not format exFAT in XP/2003 because currently there is no utilities to do this.


----------
Installing
----------

Just run INSTALL.BAT

Note: A system reboot is required to enable exFAT.


------------
Uninstalling
------------

Just run REMOVE.BAT

Note: Before removing, you must quit any application that using exFAT feature (such as Explorer). 
      A system reboot is also required to disable exFAT.


-----
Notes
-----

Good luck!
